intro: Eulophia thollonii, commonly known as the Thollon's eulophia, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to Madagascar. This terrestrial orchid typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. It features a sympodial growth habit with a pseudobulb and long, narrow leaves. The plant produces intricate, fragrant flowers in shades of white and yellow, often with a distinctive lip. Due to its habitat specificity and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
